body: I think it's fair to move on to Java 11. Today Spring 6 arrived which baselines to Java 17, we are not even on the edge of things with this in mind, so thumbs up for bumping to 11.
@raphw that's unexpected win-win outcome :-), thanks @TimvdLippe for this 3rd option, I can take it (under new issue) if no one is working on it at the moment.

issue.title: Release Mockito 5

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body:
All right, the information is scattered throughout a couple of GitHub issues, but let's summarize the changes we want to make for Mockito 5:

- [x] Change default mockmaker to inline mockmaker (#2589)
- [x] Update minimum Java version to 11 (#2798)
- [x] Add `type()` method to `ArgumentMatcher` to fix vararg integration (#2807)
- [x] Remove internal `VarargsMatcher` (#2835)

I propose that we do not include any other breaking changes, as I think these two will already have a large impact. Since I would like our users to be able to upgrade to the latest version of Mockito, even with breaking changes, I think these bumps are already sufficiently large.

Please see the linked GitHub issues for a status update on what we need to do.

body:
I filed #2802 to consolidate the changes for Mockito 5. For this issue, we will need to:

- [x] Bump our minimum Java version to 11 specified here: https://github.com/mockito/mockito/blob/0ce902af967cca91cb9ff2beaac95e44406bd175/gradle/java-library.gradle#L17-L18
- [x] Additionally, we can look into remove our JavaDoc hack (https://github.com/mockito/mockito/tree/main/gradle/mockito-core/java-8-docs) which effectively reverts #2766
- [x] We need to update our version of JavaDoc here: https://github.com/mockito/mockito/blob/0ce902af967cca91cb9ff2beaac95e44406bd175/gradle/mockito-core/javadoc.gradle#L48
- [x] Remove 8 from our build matrix: https://github.com/mockito/mockito/blob/0ce902af967cca91cb9ff2beaac95e44406bd175/.github/workflows/ci.yml#L32
- [x] Update all matrix checks to run on 11 instead: https://github.com/mockito/mockito/blob/0ce902af967cca91cb9ff2beaac95e44406bd175/.github/workflows/ci.yml#L51
- [x] Remove all checks in `.gradle` files that check for Version 8 explicitly: https://github.com/mockito/mockito/blob/0ce902af967cca91cb9ff2beaac95e44406bd175/subprojects/module-test/module-test.gradle#L5
- [x] Remove all checks in `.gradle` files that check if we are Java 9 compatible: https://github.com/mockito/mockito/blob/0ce902af967cca91cb9ff2beaac95e44406bd175/subprojects/inline/inline.gradle#L17

We can clean up the source code in `src/main/java` to remove all reflection usages (and thus solve this ticket) in Mockito 5.1.0. I would prefer to make it a clean cut first, so that upgrading is relatively straightforward. Then fixes go in a minor release, so that we can catch regressions separately.

Let me know if you think I missed something. I would welcome some PRs to get these fixed!

Signed-off-by: Andriy Redko <andriy.redko@aiven.io>

Fixes https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/2798

## Checklist

 - [X] Read the [contributing guide](https://github.com/mockito/mockito/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)
 - [X] PR should be motivated, i.e. what does it fix, why, and if relevant how
 - [ ] If possible / relevant include an example in the description, that could help all readers
       including project members to get a better picture of the change
 - [ ] Avoid other runtime dependencies
 - [X] Meaningful commit history ; intention is important please rebase your commit history so that each
       commit is meaningful and help the people that will explore a change in 2 years
 - [X] The pull request follows coding style
 - [X] Mention `Fixes #<issue number>` in the description _if relevant_
 - [X] At least one commit should mention `Fixes #<issue number>` _if relevant_
